definition: dish (type of food)/vegetable/cuisine/CL:盤|盘[pan2],道[dao4]/(coll.) (one's) type/(of one's skills etc) weak/poor

sentences.english: The vegetable farmers space out the Chinese cabbage about 30cm apart.
sentences.chinese: 菜农每隔约30公分种一颗大白菜。

sentences.english: The current vegetable price slump has taken its toll on Chinese farmers.
sentences.chinese: 近日蔬菜价格暴跌使广大的中国菜农损失惨重。

sentences.english: We all know how to plant vegetables for my father was once a vegetable grower.
sentences.chinese: 我们都知道怎么种菜，因为爸爸曾经是菜农。

sentences.english: In my small, even the vegetable farmers in Shanghai suburbs, we all shout Ah Heung.
sentences.chinese: 在我小的时候，连上海郊区的菜农，我们都喊阿乡。

sentences.english: The then 14-year-old daughter of vegetable farmers had little choice in the matter.
sentences.chinese: 当时这个十四岁的菜农的女儿在这件事上没什么选择。

sentences.english: Jiang Haihong is a vegetable farmer in Yu Zhong county, in northwestern Gansu Province.
sentences.chinese: 蒋海宏是中国西北甘肃省榆中县的一名菜农。

sentences.english: Vegetable prices rise during the journey from producer to consumer.
sentences.chinese: 在由菜农到消费者的环节中，蔬菜价格水涨船高。

definition: our peasant friends (political term used in the early years of the Old Democratic Revolution, 1840-1919)/(Tw) (coll.) farmer
